Package edu.rit.gec8773.laps

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
edu.rit.gec8773.laps.topDownParser.topDown.TopDownParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<Parser>
public abstract class Parser
extends Object
implements Serializable, Iterable<Parser>
Parser builds parsing graphs (allowing cycles) of type Parser. These graphs work with Scanners to parse input.
See Also:
Scanner, Serialized Form

      protected ArrayList<Parser> parsingRules

  • Constructor Details

    • Parser

      private Parser​(Object[] rules) throws InvocationTargetException
      Collects all the potential rules and recursively builds the topDownParser tree. A list of potential rules include:
      • Parameter describing a token
      • Parser containing a constructed topDownParser
      • Token
      • Class representing another grammar rule
      Parameters:
      rules - 0 or more potential rules
      Throws:
      InvocationTargetException - when the user provides a token which is not recognized or when another exception generated by the user

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public abstract Object parse​(Scanner sc) throws IOException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException
      Parses input tokens from a Scanner and runs user code on the created abstract syntax tree.
      Parameters:
      sc - the Scanner to read from
      Returns:
      the created abstract syntax tree
      Throws:
      IOException - when the Scanner has an I/O error
      InvocationTargetException - when there is an uncaught exception in a method marked with RunAfterEachInit, RunBeforeEachInit, and RunBeforeFirstInit
      InstantiationException - when there is an uncaught exception in a constructor of a grammar rule
      See Also:
      Scanner

    • returnTokens

      public abstract void returnTokens​(Scanner sc)
      Returns the tokens which have been consumed by the topDownParser back to the Scanner with intent to parse other grammar rules
      Parameters:
      sc - the Scanner to return to

    • getGrammarClass

      public Class<?> getGrammarClass()
      Returns the associated Class if it exists otherwise null
      Returns:
      the associated Class

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the paring rule
      Returns:
      the name

    • isList

      public boolean isList()
      Check if **= should be used when writing a BNF grammar
      Returns:
      true if grammar rules are lists

      Checks if the topDownParser has any sub parsers

    • seq

      private static Parser seq​(Object... rules) throws InvocationTargetException
      Creates a topDownParser which accepts a sequence of tokens or other grammar rules. This grammar rules are typically created by grammarRule(Class).
      Parameters:
      rules - an array of 0 or more grammatical elements
      Returns:
      the topDownParser
      Throws:
      InvocationTargetException - when the user causes an exception
      See Also:
      for all acceptable types

    • token

      private static Parser token​(Token token) throws InvocationTargetException
      Creates a topDownParser which accepts tokens of the same type as the passed in token.
      Parameters:
      token - of the token type which should be accepted
      Returns:
      the topDownParser
      Throws:
      InvocationTargetException - when the user causes an exception

    • grammarRule

      public static Parser grammarRule​(Class<?> cls) throws InvocationTargetException
      Creates a topDownParser from the passed in Class using the class's constructors as acceptable rules for parsing.
      Parameters:
      cls - the class used as the skeleton
      Returns:
      the topDownParser constructed
      Throws:
      InvocationTargetException - when the user causes an exception
